sentences.en: Bud has invited us to go sailing this weekend.
sentences.cn: 巴德邀请我们这个周末驾船出游。

sentences.en: Experienced seamen will advise you about sailing in this weather.
sentences.cn: 有经验的海员会告诉你在这种天气下的航行情况.

sentences.en: He found sailing more pleasurable than skiing.
sentences.cn: 他觉得驾驶帆船比滑雪更好玩。

sentences.en: His favourite childhood pursuits were sailing, swimming and cycling.
sentences.cn: 儿时他最大的爱好是帆船运动、游泳和骑自行车。

sentences.en: His sailing instructor fell overboard and drowned during a lesson.
sentences.cn: 他的航海教练在一次训练课时从船上失足跌入水中，溺水身亡。

sentences.en: I doubt whether Jack could manage a sailing boat.
sentences.cn: 我怀疑杰克会不会驾驶帆船.

sentences.en: Pregnancy wasn't all plain sailing and once again there were problems.
sentences.cn: 孕期并非一帆风顺，这不，又出现问题了。

sentences.en: Sailing boats lay at anchor in the narrow waterway.
sentences.cn: 帆船停泊在狭窄的水道上。
帆船运动根本就不便宜。

sentences.en: The little sailing-boat moved briskly along, heeling over under a nice breeze.
sentences.cn: 小帆船在和风中倾侧着轻快地向前开。

sentences.en: The ship is outward bound , sailing away from its home port.
The ships sailing from Florida were landing arms and combatants.
sentences.cn: 由佛罗里达来的船只正在卸武器,并让武装人员上岸.

sentences.en: The sunken sailing-boat was a glimmer of white on the bottom.
sentences.cn: 沉没的帆船在海底闪烁着白光。

sentences.en: There was swimming and sailing down on the lake.
sentences.cn: 有人在湖上游泳和扬帆。

sentences.en: They warned him of the dangers of sailing alone.
sentences.cn: 他们警告他说独自航行危险重重。

words.tran_cn: 航行，[水运]航海；启航；航海术
[水运]航行，起航（sail的现在分词形式）

phrases.tran_cn: 去航海，去航行；进行帆船运动

trans.tran_cn: 帆船运动，（乘帆船的）航行，（轮船的）航班
trans.tran_en: the sport or activity of travelling in or directing a small boat with sails

trans.tran_cn: 驾驶( sail的现在分词)，起航，坐船旅行，掠
